subject: Cybersecurity
title: What Is a Firewall? The First Line of Defense
description: Learn What Is a Firewall? The First Line of Defense in one minute.

hook.text: A firewall decides which network traffic gets in and which gets blocked â€” like a bouncer at a digital nightclub.

buildup.text: Firewalls filter traffic based on rules: source/destination IP, port numbers, protocols, and connection state.

discovery.text: Packet-filtering firewalls check individual packets. Stateful firewalls track entire connections for smarter decisions.

twist.text: Next-generation firewalls (NGFWs) can inspect encrypted traffic, identify applications, and block malware â€“ far.

climax.text: Firewalls are necessary but insufficient. They're just one layer in a defense-in-depth strategy.

punchline.text: A firewall is a bouncer. But determined intruders find other doors.

quiz.question: What is the difference between stateful and packet-filtering firewalls?
options: Stateful firewalls track entire connections while packet-filtering checks individual packets
